fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47578].
  {panel}

As a System Administrator, I would like to keep my emails in the mail box if JIRA has any exception during the processing of these messages.

The mail handler should only delete email messages after the contents have been successfully saved to a new or existing issue. Email messages should not be deleted from the mailbox if there is an error (permissions or otherwise) that prevent the message contents been saved into the JIRA DB. Emails left in the mailbox to be marked as processed by marking them as "read".

If there is a failure to add the contents of an incoming email to an existing or new issue in JIRA, the reason for failure and the contents of the email should be saved to the error log file.

Currently, if JIRA finds any permission problem when it tries to add a mail comment, it will proceed deleting the message even though the content was not added.
fields.summary: Email messages should not be deleted from the mailbox if there is an error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47577].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour

The excel report's first three cells are merged, meaning that instead of being able to click and create a table, users have to remove image, header and footer rows to be able to get data into the table.

h3. Expected Behaviour

Either remove the merged cells or allow for users to be able to choose what they want to be included in the export apart from the issues / columns.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the format of the Excel report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47576].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to receive notification on overdue issues in JIRA, a filter subscription can be used to alert on this at specified times, but this would not be an immediate alert.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a Issue Overdue event in JIRA, that can be used to automatically trigger actions e.g. send notification when the due date of an issue is past.
fields.summary: Issue Overdue event configurable via notification schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47573].
  {panel}

Please add to documentation at this page [Restoring a Project from Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup] following block. Feel free to modify the exact wording. 
-----
During project import *Create Issue* transition will be triggered for each issue and as part of that all corresponding _postfunction_ will be executed. Also it will fire a _Issue Created_ event that can be processed by the listeners. If you do specific action in *Create Issue* transition which affects import, the workaround will be to manually disable _postfunction_ during import.
-----
Thanks.
fields.summary: Documentation request: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47567].
  {panel}

In general, whenever changing the status of an issue away from a certain group of statuses (closed, resolved, etc) issues should be set to unresolved

Currently this is very painful to setup in the workflow editor as you must create & customise the transition to/from almost every single status you support

The "allow all statuses to transition to this one" feature made it easy to setup flexible workflows without having to setup all of these transitions, but the resolution field makes it pointless

My suggestion is either you change the default behaviour of jira so that moving an issue to or away from a Done status triggers resolution or sets unresolved

Alternatively, make it an option on the edit status dialog when editing a workflow
fields.summary: Improve handling of resolution in workflow editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47563].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding in *com.atlassian.mail.incoming.jepp* to Default Loggers at *Logging & Profiling* page , it doesn't displayed at the package list . 

h3. Environment
*  JIRA 6.4.10 
*  JIRA 6.4.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Logging & Profilling* page
# At *Default Loggers* section , *Configure* logging level for another package. For package name , set as *com.atlassian.mail.incoming.jepp* and Logging Level set as *DEBUG*.

h3. Expected Results
*com.atlassian.mail.incoming.jepp* displayed in the package list.

h3. Actual Results
*com.atlassian.mail.incoming.jepp* is not displayed in the package list . 

h3. Notes
In future , if user want to update the logging level , need to go back at the configuration and change the logging level.
fields.summary: Default Loggers doesn't displayed new configured package

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47558].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a few Projects.
2. Modify the database record for one of the projects such that the lead field point to a non-existing user.
3. Go to the Browse Projects page and type a few character in the search box to narrow down the list of projects on the page.

h3. Actual Results

* Results are not filtered and you should see a javascript error in the console similar to:

{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of null(anonymous function) @ jira.webresources:browseprojects.js?locale=en-US:9filterCollection @ jira.webresources:browseprojects.js?locale=en-US:9B @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:636Z.Events.trigger @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:636l.extend.set @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:636inputsContains @ jira.webresources:browseprojects.js?locale=en-US:30w @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:536
{noformat} 

h3. Expected Results

* The list of projects is filtered according to the search criteria without any errors.

h3. Workaround / Notes

* Adjusting the project lead username so that it matches a user known to JIRA will fix the issue.
fields.summary: An invalid project lead will cause the browse projects page search functionality to stop working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47557].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 9 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks for your attention and patience. We have worked to identify the root cause of this issue and provide a fix as soon as possible. 

*We have released JIRA Core 7.0.4 which contains a fix for this security vulnerability.* We recommend that anyone currently using JIRA 7.0.3 upgrade as soon as possible. There are more details available in [the security advisory here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2015-12-09].

At this point we consider this issue resolved. If you have any questions, please contact Atlassian Support.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández. 
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].

{panel}

h3. Summary
When an issue receives an update and an e-mail notification is sent to users about the updates or changes, and the update contains a wiki markup inline reference to an external image. The email sent will be attached with an internal image from another unrelated issue in the JIRA instance instead of the external image.  


h3. Environment
Cloud Environment / JIRA Server 7.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* User A views an issue X with an inline wiki markup reference to an image attachment.
* User B comments / updates another issue Y and includes an external image reference via wiki markup.
* An email notification is sent for the change made to Y.
* [BUG] The notification email will display the internal image attached to Issue A instead of the external image.

h3. Expected Results
Email notifications should not include attachments that have not been referenced in the change to the JIRA issue in question

h3. Actual Results
Users receive email notifications containing attachments of unrelated issues instead of the one that was meant to be in the notification. 
 
h3. Notes
More details available at the [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2015-12-09]

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: JIRA is sending attachments of unrelated issues on notifications received by e-mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47555].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently JIRA the sub-task will inherit the parent issue's component by default even if the component was not selected in sub-task creation.

*Suggested Solution*
Prevent JIRA from automatically adding the component automatically to the sub-task if none was selected during sub-task creation.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Make Component inheritance optional in Sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47554].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently JIRA the sub-task can increase the time estimates for the parent task. User would like restrict the sub-task so that it will respect the time estimate set to the parent task.

*Suggested Solution*
Add option in JIRA for the Project lead to restrict sub-task so it will follows the time estimation of the parent issue.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow Sub-Task to increase time estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47545].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Icon of custom issue type is not shown in email notification to users.

 !Screenshot from 2015-11-30 18-31-00.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
6.4.11, 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a custom issue type.
2) Choose a random icon provided in JIRA.
3) When user receive notification from JIRA related to this particular issue type, the icon of this issue type won't be shown.

h3. Expected Results

Email notification should display the custom issue type's icon selected in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results

Icons not displayed in email notification.

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Icon of custom issue type not shown in email notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47542].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When perform modification on custom field, the changes does no reflect in the audit log.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type 'Select List (single choice)' with 2 options (single word options, no strange characters)
# Go to audit log, we can see that activity properly logged (a 'Custom field created' record has been added)
# Now edit the configuration of the previously created custom field by adding a new option (single word option, no strange characters)

h3. Expected Results
Go back to the audit log and there is additional log for that activity

h3. Actual Results
Go back to the audit log and there is no additional log for that activity
fields.summary: custom field updated does not reflect in the audit log
Health Check for Clustering like Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47540].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently it's not possible in JIRA's UI to sum up the total of the column, to find the sum you need to export the data.

h3. Suggested Solution

For each column in the issue navigator that contains numbers, add the value of each row to one another to provide a total.
 
h3. Workaround

Use [Limbr Reports for JIRA Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/limbr-reports/cloud/overview] for Cloud, [SumUp|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.cps.sumUp] for Server or [export search results to excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/exporting-search-results-to-microsoft-excel-735937195.html]
fields.summary: Sum up the total for columns in the JIRA issue navigator
JIRA - JIRA application link documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47530].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA by default displays all dates relative to when they occurred and can be configured to be displayed as an actual date, as per JRA-45928.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an alternative option here to show exactly the dates in hh:mm format.
 
For example: 
# Let's say the issue was created 29/Nov/15 11:10 AM.
# User is viewing the issue at 29/Nov/15 11:20 AM, the Created field needs to show 10m ago.
# And when the user view the same issue later in the day at 29/Nov/15 2:20 PM, the Created field should be 3h 10m ago.
fields.summary: Add another alternative to relative dates.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47514].
  {panel}

Steps
1. Open ListBoxer.exe
2. Check "Alphabetic" or "Alphabetic"+"Numeric" mode in the "Symbols" menu.
3. Enter a string with a $ symbol at any position in the string. The string can also have the allowed symbols.
4. Hit Enter or Click the "Add to List" button
Expected Result
The $ symbol does NOT appear in the text field as you enter it (similar to any other disallowed symbols). A string with a $ symbol can NOT be added to the list.
Actual Result
The $ symbol appears in the text field as you enter it. A string with a $ symbol can be added to the list.
fields.summary: One can add a string with a $ symbol in the Alphabetic or Alphabetic+Numeric mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47506].
  {panel}

When we have a workflow status change, the workflow step ID is updated and after that the status ID. The entire operation take just a few milliseconds, however, since the transition options are displayed based on the workflow step ID and not based on the status ID, if we run a REST API call to get the available transition statuses, we might see a discrepancy. If we run the REST call again, the correct information is displayed. 

Please note this issue is very hard to replicate since the entire operation takes just a few milliseconds, however, if you're running an automated script to get the available status, there might be a discrepancy and cause problems to the backend systems which relies on that information.

An example can be seen in the screenshots below.

 !image1.png|thumbnail!  !current_workflow.png|thumbnail! 

It would be great to change the way JIRA updates the database to have this information updated simultaneously.
fields.summary: Update the Workflow Step ID and Status ID in the database at the same time in order to avoid available transitions discrepancy.
Enhance JQL with WAS operator for Affects Version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47433].
  {panel}

Hello,
My workflow requirement goes like this....
1. At the top, an user story should tell me the phase wise status.
2. Story will have sub-tasks & also corresponds to a new issue type called Verification Task.
3. Based on the statuses of sub-task the story status should reflect.
4. At one point (after 3-4 sub tasks gets to closure) upon a transition at story level, it should create another issue type called Verification Task.
5. At one point even that Verif Task reaches a state upon its status the story status should get changed and at this point need another issue type to be triggered.
6. Finally based on the 2-3 step process this new issue type gets done and that's when the story finally should reach Done/closed state.
Please suggest the best way to configure this workflow. 
Thanks for your time!
Raghav
fields.summary: Custom workflow design - Need support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47400]. {panel} h3. Problem Definition As an administrator I would like JIRA Announcement banner code to be isolated from the JIRA and the plugins code. This is to prevent any code in Announcement banner to cause any outages on the instance. At the moment, if an incorrect code is entered in the announcement banner then it can cause major outages on the JIRA instance leading to an instance that is unusable. Sample HTML code that can cause major problems : {noformat}
Jira system now in the new version 6.4.12. To find out more about the new features please click this link: Jira Upgrade
{noformat} (i) Note that in the above banner code there is a missing HTML end parameter
. This is what caused the problems in Structure and the "hide menu" feature in Jira Agile. h3. Suggested Solution Make sure that the code in the announcement banner is not easily able to leave the instance unusable.
fields.summary: As an admin I want JIRA to isolate the Announcement banner code with the JIRA code
"Confirmation" check for clicking "Cancel" for story/bug creation, adding comment etc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47388].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA sets the default timeout value to 10 seconds when configuring the Outgoing mail server. This is usually good enough for users, but it is known to be the cause for a very common problem with duplicated notifications as seen [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Read+timed+out+error+when+sending+outbound+mail+from+JIRA+applications].

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if the default timeout was set to 5 minutes since that is the value set by the [SMTP definition in the RFC docs|https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2821.txt] for timeouts.

h3. Workaround 
Manually update the timeout value in JIRA's Outgoing mail configuration
fields.summary: Increase default Timeout for Outgoing mail server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47386].
  {panel}

h5. Definition
When the Detail View is selected on Issue Navigator, issues will appear on a left panel and their issue key + summary will appear for a quick identification.

h5. Suggestion
Add the ability for JIRA users to customize that view (i.e. similar to the JIRA Software cards on a Board) and change what fields are displayed there or include more.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the left panel of the Issue Navigator when Detail View is selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47379].
  {panel}

Please roll back the recent changes to the Users and Roles screen. Like so many other things you've done recently it has just made Jira worse.
- The screen is now longer because of extra details and extra white space. Result: I've lost the one-page overview.
- You no longer show all the members of a role. Instead I get 'Showing 5 of 10' with a 'Show All' link. Result: I've lost the one-page overview.
- Adding users to roles takes more clicks now.
- The 'Show more' link shows less; if I want to see all my developers I no longer see who's in any other role on the project. 'Show less' shows more; it fill the screen with all roles in the project.
fields.summary: Change the Project 'Users and Roles' screen back to how it was

h5. Definition
Under the current circumstances:

* If you are not watching an issue, once you are mentioned, you will receive a notification alerting you through the wording: *someone mentioned you on AB22* 
* If you are already watching the case, once you are mentioned, it comes through as: *someone commented on AB22*. 

h5. Suggestion
Customer would appreciate if in both cases, the alert says something in line: *someone mentioned you on AB22*
fields.summary: Improvement in alerting issue watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47365].
  {panel}

In *Portfolio for JIRA Licensing and Pricing* documentation:
- https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/jira-portfolio/

Under the Section:
{quote}
Server Licenses
1. What does a new Portfolio for JIRA license cost?
{quote}


Below the License Chart:
{quote}
Note: Portfolio for JIRA is a plugin for JIRA Sofware. The Portfolio fir JIRA license type and user count must match that of the JIRA Software Server license it is being used with. For instance, a 25 User Commercial JIRA Software Server license will require a 25 User Commercial Portfolio for JIRA license.
{quote}

Typo1:
"The Portfolio {{fir}} JIRA license type"

*FIR* should be:
- FOR

Typo2:
"Note: Portfolio for JIRA is a plugin for JIRA {{Sofware}}."

*Sofware* should be 
- Software
fields.summary: Typo In Licensing Documentation
Customizable Issue Collector Form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47277].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA identifies user based on username and not ID. 

This could be a problem in scenarios where a user with username example *john* who has been using JIRA leaves the company. Thereafter if a new user called John joins the company, then AD would give him the username john as the previous one had been deleted. However, as in JIRA the username john is associated with the old user, then this new user will automatically be handled as the same person as the old user

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of username, use user ID.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want JIRA to use ID instead of username as identifier for users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, for wildcard searching in JQL only available within the word itself.

h3. Suggested Solution
If there is a more intuitive way of searching in JQL via wildcard such as:
*  support leading wildcards or Wildcards in phrases
fields.summary: more extensive search for wildcard usage in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary 
It was previously raised and resolved at [JRA-27926|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27926] but this bug reappear again. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any gadget. For example Filter Results gadget
# click on the Tools icon
# Select Create Sub-Task 
# Sub-Task issue type is not listed 
# Creating Sub-Task is not a problem via the view Issue Screen

h3. Current Result
Sub-task issue type is not listed

h3. Expected Result
Sub-task issue type should be listed from pop up window

h3. Workaround
Create a Sub-task from _Issue View Screen_
fields.summary: Create Subtask from Filter Results gadget does not list Subtask Issue Type

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47270].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently [Support Tools Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.support.stp/cloud/overview] provides Attachment Health Check. But the health check was able to confirm that the most recent attachment can be found in the file system and database.

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend this functionality to perform a health check of all the attachment. This will be useful to have as on-demand basis where user can perform a health check after data migration.
fields.summary: Extend the functionality of Attachment Health Check

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47250].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In activity screen of projects, it's not possible to switch to Statistics view, it provides the following error:

The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Cloud environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open the cog menu > Projects > Select any software project > Click on "Back to project" > Click on the project name on the left top corner > Click on switch view and then finally click on Statistics.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the statistics view for the selected project.

h3. Actual Results
It does not open the statistics screen and shows up this error:

The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
fields.summary: In activity screen of projects, it's not possible to switch to Statistics view
JIRA Express

h3. Summary
Since the latest Cloud release, it seems like the JIRA Text Gadget increased the default amount of vertical spacing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a Text Gadget

h3. Actual Results (on JIRA v7.1.0-OD-01-053).

fields.summary: JIRA Text Gadget increased the amount of default vertical spacing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47191].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
All items in the column on Wallboard View will be cycled through every a few seconds (if there are too many) and there is no any option to configure this. It would be great to have this option so that users can set how many seconds the items will be cycled.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Provide an option to configure cycle period for items in the column on Wallboard View.
fields.summary: Option to configure cycle period for items in the column on Wallboard View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47188].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, It is not explicitly mentioned that Group has to be created on AD side to get synchronized to JIRA. Some users might have the understanding that synchronizing JIRA and LDAP directory will include synchronizing local groups (created in JIRA) to LDAP directory.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to mention this in the documentation that groups are to be created in LDAP to get synchronized to JIRA, while local groups (created in JIRA) will not be synchronized to LDAP.
fields.summary: Update LDAP documentation on LDAP and JIRA synchronization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47187].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The customer wanted to Customize the Issue View Layout. By Default all the custom fields will be added directly below each other and all of these will be wrapped inside the detail section with left-aligned. The customer want the custom field to be right-aligned in too and also able to move certain custom fields from left to right when needed.

How to replicate the problem :
Screenshot: 
!test.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Log in to JIRA
# Add few numbers of custom fields(Text Field-Single Line) at Administration>Issues>Custom Fields (eg: text1,text2,test3,test4)
# Associate the fields with the default screen used for the Jira Issue.
# Open any one of the Issue
# Add all the added custom fields in step 2 to the Issue Page by clicking Admin>Add Field
# Try to move the few of the custom fields added in the the left side to the right side. 
Eg :  (eg: Move test3,test4 from left side by default to the right side)



h3. Suggested Solution
When adding the custom field in the Issue Page , the customer should be able to move the custom field to be right-aligned.
The customer also should be able to move certain custom fields from the left to the right when needed.
fields.summary: Customize the Issue View Layout to add Custom Field with right-aligned
Create a picklist on Contact

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47182].

I'm trying to add a new gadget from confluence to a Jira Dashboard. Based on the documentation available, I should be able to do this but I need to contact Atlassian. Can you please advice? The new gadget I need are the following: 

https://dsgemm.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:confluence-page-gadget/gadgets/confluence-page-gadget.xml

https://dsgemm.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:confluence-page-gadget/gadgets/confluence-page-gadget.xml

In Atlassian OnDemand products, it is not possible for administrators to add gadgets to the directory. If you would like to add an Atlassian gadget to a directory, please contact Atlassian Support.

We're running JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-001
fields.summary: Unable to add a new gadget to a dashboard using OnDemand product

Hello,

(note , using JIRA v 6.4.10)
With the current iteration of JIRA the old issue based project overview is quite hard to find

{quote}
The old Project Summary overview can still be accessed with the new Project view:

    go to "Summary" (top link in the Project navigation bar: the project avatar)
    click on "Activity" -> change it to "Statistics"
{quote}

I have had a lot of questions about this from our users, and apparently we are not the only ones :

* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/23758217/answers/32524295?flashId=-1420565710
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15701804/answers/32524268?flashId=1115121407

Access to this page should be easier to find and/or it should be possible to mark this page as the default landing page for a project ( related issue : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42283)

thanks and best regards,
Loïc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47172].
  {panel}

Since the move to new project types in JIRA 7.0, it's not possible anymore to create projects using JIRA's classic default workflow and issue type schemes.

The classic workflows are still present with no assigned project in a clean installation.

h4. Workaround
If you currently have projects created using the "Classic Project" template, new projects can be created using a shared configuration in JIRA 7.0. This will use the workflow and issue type scheme, besides any other configuration, from an existing project.
fields.summary: Bring "Classic Project" template back

fields.summary: Display empty fields on Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47168].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
Add a gadget to show issues currently assigned to me
Assign n+1 entries to the current user where n := the number shown per page
View the NEXT TO LAST page of issues
In another tab, open/resolve one issue assigned to that user.
Click to view the next (last) page of issues assigned to that user.

(so if 10 issues per page, create 11, resolve one (in another tab), then try to view page 2 of data)

Result:
The gadget reports that 0 issues are assigned to the user.

Workaround:
The bug is just a temporary issue and reloading the page fixes it; not sure if the autoupdate would or not though.

Expected result (suggested):
View the first page of issues for that user

Since you are requesting page x+1 of x pages, the desired behavior is a little ambiguous but the most reasonable seems to be to just reload the first page of data for the gadget.
fields.summary: Assigned to me gadget reports 0 issues incorrectly
How to deploy JIRA 7.0  with CDN

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47058].
  {panel}

When upgrading JIRA, the pre-stage version will have new versions of the plugins, that are compatible with the upgraded version at some point - these can be copied across into the {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} directory of the production upgrade before it's started, so that the reindex doesn't have to happen twice.

This is important for larger instances as the indexing time can take a large time, so currently:

# You upgrade JIRA, then reindex.
# Install new plugins.
# Reindex again.

The change proposes:

# Upgrade JIRA.
# Copy across the upgraded plugins on pre-stage from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} into the new version.
# Start JIRA, reindex, no need to reindex again.
fields.summary: Update our Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method documentation to include plugin changes for major versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47053].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Workflow Sharing plugin or the "Import/Export Workflow" feature did not include the plugins items on workflow import.

h3. Suggested Solution
Import all plugins items found in the workflow .jwb file once the identified plugin verified to be installed in target JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use workflow XML to export/import workflow between JIRA instances.
fields.summary: Include Plugins Items on Import Workflow from file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47052].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On larger instances the index process can be time consuming. A background index is also required when you upgrade the plugins post upgrade. The Data Center option is one route. Though it would be good to have an option to trigger the index after accessing the instance to upgrade plugins ect. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have a supported version of disabling the index task during the upgrade. Perhaps adding modifiers similar to the database update to [fixing indexing disabled post upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/After+upgrading+JIRA+indexing+is+disabled]
fields.summary: Provide option to disable Index task during upgrade.
Enable the possibility to filter on issues that are not in an "end state"
Move ''Save as'' Button out of the Way on Filters Banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47047].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no in built report or gadget in JIRA that allows a user to configure a report on how specific values of a field changes against time. e.g. a bar chart to see the trend of issues reported by a specified user or couple of users over the past few months; or trend of issues having a particular custom field value over time.

The closest to this currently available in JIRA is the pie-charts. However, this can only capture static of the current time.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a configurable generic charting gadget that could be used to create reports on how a specific issue statistic changes over time JIRA.
* This gadget should also allow configurability of timeframe e.g. weekly, monthly etc
fields.summary: As a user I would like a configurable generic report of given Issue statistic against time
Jira reindex triggered during upgrade doesn't indicate progress in log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46878].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently JIRA 7 will be using 
# Default Software Permission Scheme for Software project.
# Default Permission Scheme for Business project.
Even after all the software projects are associated to Default Permission Scheme and Default Software Permission Scheme is deleted, when user try to create a new Software project, it will recreate new Default Software Permission Scheme and use it.

*Suggested Solution*
Allow user to delete Default Software Permission Scheme permanently so when user create a new software project it will be using Default Permission Scheme.

*Workaround*
User will have to manually switch to Default Permission Scheme after the project creation.
fields.summary: Allow all Projects in JIRA 7 to use Default Permission Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46831].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[This documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-getUser] has a section where the 'Find users' GET operation using '/rest/api/2/user/search' is explained.

The example in this section uses '/rest/api/2/user' instead of '/rest/api/2/user/search'. 

A section for '/rest/api/2/user' is already present above.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to show examples of '/rest/api/2/user/search' in this section.
fields.summary: Fix examples in documentation on '/user/search' REST API documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46830].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
(!) Please notice that the session endpoint does not work with the [API Tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html]. 

{panel}

The REST API seems to be rejecting valid credentials.

URL hit is https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/auth/1/session, getting a 401 with correct credentials.


h3. Workaround
Most of the times this happens because of the bruteforce protection mechanism. A way to have this working again is to reset the password for the user in [id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com] by going to:
- https://id.atlassian.com/manage/change-password

If this is not applicable because you didn't have a password previously set in [id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com] and therefore you cannot use the change-password form. Then do the following:
# Go to https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
# Enter you email, complete the CAPTCHA and click on *Send*
# Once you receive the password reset email, do not click on the button to *Access* but on the link below that says "reset password". 
# Fill up the new password and you are done.
fields.summary: REST API /rest/auth/1/session 401 with correct credentials

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46828].

*Suggestion Summary*
Following the release of JIRA 7 and the addition of the new project navigation(making it compulsory), Project Admins and Leads are no longer able to see various summaries and filters(features) that used to be available on the page.

This is can be seen in the attached images.

*Expected Result*
Despite the changes to project navigation, all previously available features on the project issue overview page would still be available.

*Actual Result*
Page has been streamlined with most of the features tucked away and at times requiring one extra click to reach them or entirely removed from the page.
fields.summary: Improve Project Issue Overview in JIRA 7
